item.title: Promotion
item.itunes:author: Taco Wednesday
item.itunes:subtitle: What happens when laziness meets career growth?
item.itunes:summary: Dan really likes his current job within the outgoing orders department. Unfortunately, when the position of technical supervisor becomes available, upper management looks in his direction to fill the vacancy. In Promotion, Dan attempts to cordially deny the new job offer despite Mr. Johnsonapos;s incessant pleas to do otherwise.
item.itunes:keywords: Film, Movies, Student films, Promotion, Taco Wednesday, Comedy, Office Space, The Office, Office, Dark comedy, black comedy, indie films, Indiana, Santa Cruz, UCSC, Berkeley

item.title: Student for Change
item.itunes:author: Taco Wednesday
item.itunes:subtitle: Socially awkward and not very smart.
item.itunes:summary: Student for Change is a "documentary" that takes place on a single afternoon and evening in the life of David, a below-average, socially misguided 20-year-old at UC Santa Cruz.
item.itunes:keywords: Film, Movies, Student films, Social Justice, Community, Taco Wednesday, Comedy, Dark comedy, black comedy, indie films, Indiana, Santa Cruz, UCSC, Berkeley

item.title: Things That Happen After You Die
item.itunes:author: Taco Wednesday
item.itunes:subtitle: A dark comedy about ending it all.
item.itunes:summary: Logan's life hits a speed bump when his Ethiopian Aunt dies suddenly. Feeling he isn't receiving his fair share of attention, Logan (Josh McClain) attempts to fake his own suicide to garner some sympathy. His secret is kept from his best friend Stan (Alex Kramer), his girlfriend Vanessa (Katherine Lelek), and his parents (Don & Kim McClain). Logan decides to hide out with Clayton (Nick McKibben), an acquaintance he doesn't particularly like. Unfortunately for Logan, his loved ones don't react to his death quite as he hoped. How will Logan cope with the world's negligence to his memory? Not well.
item.itunes:keywords: Film, Movies, Student films, Things That Happen After You Die, Taco Wednesday, Comedy, Dark comedy, black comedy, indie films, Indiana, Santa Cruz, UCSC, Berkeley

item.title: A Friendly Negotiation
item.itunes:author: Taco Wednesday
item.itunes:subtitle: All the cool people are in Hell.
item.itunes:summary: Working as God's intern, Gabriel's job requires him to convince Satan that a person of dubious karma has somehow earned a place in heaven.
item.itunes:keywords: Film, Movies, Student films, Bad Woods, Taco Wednesday, Comedy, Dark comedy, black comedy, indie films, Indiana, Santa Cruz, UCSC, Berkeley

item.title: Computer Die
item.itunes:author: Taco Wednesday
item.itunes:subtitle: Computers and violence.
item.itunes:summary: Larry and his older brother just don't get along. While Larry enjoys the solitary hobby of personal computing, his brother enjoys maniacal senseless violence. Our story begins when these two worlds collide into a bloody and entertaining fireball of destruction.
item.itunes:keywords: Film, Movies, Student films, Bad Woods, Taco Wednesday, Comedy, Dark comedy, black comedy, indie films, Indiana, Santa Cruz, UCSC, Berkeley
